title: The Solar System Sun
original_text: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System. It is seen in the sky and gives light to the Earth. When the Sun is in the sky, it is day. When the Sun is not in the sky, it is night.

title: Minneapolis and St. Paul
original_text: Minneapolis is a city in Minnesota. It is next to St. Paul, Minnesota. St. Paul and Minneapolis are called the Twin Cities because they are right next to each other. title: Birds and Their World
original_text: Birds are found on every continent of the world. Birds of different types can live in freezing cold environments, and others can live in hot deserts. Birds live in forests, in grasslands, on cliff faces, in river banks, on stony sea shores, down mine shafts, and in the roofs of houses.

title: Humpback Whales
original_text: Humpback whales can live up to 45 years. They migrate between the places they feed in the winter and the places they give birth in the summer. They usually live alone.

title: The Lost Generation
original_text: The novel was called The Sun Also Rises. It is about young Americans in Europe after World War One. The war had destroyed their dreams and had given them nothing to replace those dreams. The writer Gertrude Stein later called these people members of “The Lost Generation.”

title: Exercise and Mental Health
original_text: Physical exercise is recommended for management of mild depression and has a moderate effect on symptoms. It is equivalent to the use of medications or psychological therapies for most people. In older people, it does appear to decrease depression.

title: Canberra’s Waste Vision
original_text: In 1996 Canberra was the first city in the world to set a vision of no waste by 2010. The strategy aimed to achieve a waste-free society by 2010, through the combined efforts of industry, government, and community. By early 2010, it was apparent that the ACT Government initiative had failed.

original_text: Electrical engineering has many subdisciplines, the most popular of which are listed below. title: The Opera Score
original_text: The orchestral score of the opera was published in late 1899 by Casa Ricordi. title: Antibiotics and Their Uses
original_text: An antibiotic is a chemical compound that kills bacteria or slows their growth. They are used as medicine to treat and cure diseases caused by bacteria. The first antibiotic discovered was Penicillin, a natural antibiotic produced by a fungus. Production of antibiotics first began in 1939, and in the modern day, they are made by chemical synthesis. Antibiotics can not be used to treat viruses.

title: The Printing Press
original_text: Johannes Gutenberg introduced the concept of movable type and the printing press to Europe. While this may not sound like a big deal at first, the printing press is often considered as the most important invention in modern times. Think about how important information is today. Without books and computers, you wouldn’t be able to learn to pass on information or to share scientific discoveries. Prior to Gutenberg introducing the printing press, making a book was a laborious process in Europe.

title: Birds of Prey
original_text: Birds of prey have been treated very differently over the years. For example, during the Middle Ages, red kites were highly valued. As scavengers, they helped to keep the streets of London and other towns clean of waste. However, attitudes towards red kites and other birds of prey changed in the 16th century, when a series of laws encouraged people to kill them as vermin. It wasn’t until 1954 that new laws were passed to make it illegal to kill birds of prey.

title: Owls as Symbols of Learning
original_text: Did you know owls are a symbol of learning? Libraries and bookstores sometimes use pictures of owls to represent reading or wisdom. Owls can’t really read, but they are smart.

title: Toy Story
original_text: Toy Story is a 1995 American animated movie. It was the first Pixar animated movie. Pixar made the movie while Disney packaged it and sold the reels of the movie to movie theaters. It was released on November 22, 1995. It was the first animated movie to be completely done with computers instead of hand-drawn animation. title: Steve Jobs and Apple
original_text: Steve Jobs was a Silicon Valley businessman most famous for his work with the company Apple. Together with Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak, Jobs helped make the idea of the personal computer popular in the late 1970s. title: London: A Historical City
original_text: London is the capital and largest city of England. London is the biggest city in Western Europe and the world’s largest financial center. For a long time, London was a small city. All its people lived inside the walls that were built by the Romans. Thus, the area is still called the City of London. There were many villages around the city. Gradually, more people came to live there. Then, step by step, the villages joined together into one huge city.

title: Diversity in London
original_text: Most people in London are British. However, London also has many immigrants. These people came from many different countries. title: TikTok: A Social Media Phenomenon
original_text: TikTok is an online video-sharing social networking service. It lets people create short videos and share looping videos of 60 seconds. Users can post anything from life hacks to dances or even recipes. It is popular in Canada, the United States, and other parts of the world. title: Journalism and Its Role
original_text: Journalism refers to the production and distribution of reports on recent events. The word journalism applies to the occupation, using methods of gathering information and using literary techniques. Various forms of journalistic mediums include print, television, radio, internet, and in the past: newsreels. Concepts of the appropriate role for journalism vary between countries. In some nations, the news media is controlled by government intervention and is not fully independent.

title: The Olympic Games Closing Ceremony
original_text: The closing ceremony of the Olympic Games takes place after all sporting events have concluded. Flag-bearers from each participating country enter the stadium. They are followed by the athletes who enter together without any national distinction. Three national flags are hoisted while the corresponding national anthems are played. The flag of Greece is raised to honor the birthplace of the Olympic Games, the flag of the current host country, and the flag of the country hosting the next Summer or Winter Olympic Games is also flown.

title: Astronomy and Its History
original_text: Astronomy is one of the oldest sciences. Ancient people used the positions of the stars to navigate and to find when was the best time to plant crops. Astronomy is very similar to astrophysics. A related subject, cosmology, is concerned with studying the Universe as a whole and the way the Universe changed over time. Astronomy is not the same as astrology, the belief that the motion of the stars and the planets may affect human lives.

title: Iceland and Its People
original_text: The people in Iceland are mostly of Scandinavian origin. The language they speak is Icelandic. title: Elvis Presley: The King of Rock and Roll
original_text: Elvis Presley was an American singer, musician, and actor. He is often regarded as the most influential and most famous musician of the 20th century and is widely regarded as a cultural icon. He was one of the first and most famous in rock and roll music.
